before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2rop8","text":"Before starting, it is necessary to have a thoroughly disinfected workspace. Use 10% sodium hypochlorite solutions, 70% ethanol, distilled water, and absorbent paper towels to clean the area. It is advisable to collect intestine samples from shrimp that have been recently taken out of the pond. Otherwise, it is essential to verify the integrity of this organ and confirm that it is not undergoing lysis. Additionally, a basic understanding of Linux and related working environments is recommended for processing the final reads.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6r324","text":"The Pacific white shrimp (Litopenaeus vannamei, Lv) is a non-model organism of significant global economic importance, constituting 51.7% of crustaceans produced through aquaculture. Consequently, scientific research has focused on various approaches to enhance the production of this crustacean, such as understanding the dynamics of its microbiota. Microbiota refers to the collection of microorganisms inhabiting a host organism, which can be essential for the host's healthy development. The gut is one of the most critical organs for shrimp development and survival. The current protocol outlines the methodology for adequately extracting gut samples from Lv. It describes the DNA extraction method, amplification, and purification of the V3 region of the 16S ribosomal gene and the construction of libraries for subsequent sequencing. Furthermore, it also includes a bioinformatic protocol for sequence analysis to describe the microbiota composition.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":26,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":661,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5fdor","text":"Before beginning any sample collection, it is crucial to prepare the working environment properly. Start by rinsing the surgical forceps with a 10% chlorine solution, then rinse thoroughly with sterile Milli-Q water. Next, place 1.5 ml Eppendorf tubes with 1 mL of RNAlater or 20% glycerol as preservation reagent in a rack for easy access during sampling. If collecting samples outside the laboratory, be sure to have a container of liquid nitrogen on hand to freeze the samples of 20% glycerol and a cooler with ice to keep the samples with RNAlater for transport. By taking these simple precautions, you can ensure the integrity of your samples and obtain accurate results.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hv1q","text":"From now on, use the genomic DNA extraction kit Quick-DNA Fecal/Soil Microbe MiniPrep Zymo Research. You can opt to use the ZR Bashing Bead Lysis Tube (mechanical lysis) or use the Genomic Lysis Buffer directly (chemical lysis). steps.section: Analysis of the shrimp microbiome using DADA2 by Qiime2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63f2s","text":"After sequencing, data files in a FASTQ format containing the nucleotide sequences or reads are generated. A computer or server with Ubuntu 22.04 operating system or some other linux distribution to the user's taste should be used for the analysis of the reads. {"blocks":[{"key":"1i0au","text":"Take the previously collected sample from the freezer (-70º C) and let it thaw on ice to extract the genomic DNA. Once the sample is thawed, centrifuge the tube 8,000 g for 5 min. Then, discard the supernatant, add 1 ml of phosphate buffer at pH 7.4, and let it sit on ice for 0.5-1 minute. This is to remove as much of the conservation reagent as possible.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a48nn","text":"Use the Trimmomatic tool to quality-trim your reads. Before selecting any program option, carefully review the characteristics of your reads in the fastQC results. The files can be used in a compressed .gz format.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"181ek","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5scc","text":"$ TrimmomaticPE -phred33 -threads 8 Archive_no_adapters_R1.fastq Archive_no_adapters_R2.fastq Archive_trimmo_results_R1.fastq unpaired_reads_R1.fastq Archive_trimmo_results_R2.fastq unpaired_reads_R2.fastq OPTION1:\u003cvalue\u003e OPTION2:\u003cvalue\u003e","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adaa","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p6q6","text":"The resulting unpaired files will not be used in the following steps, only the \"trimmo\" paired files.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h7ms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvd0i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d879","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhbm7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":16,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4g8q3","text":"Recommendations:","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"as1dl","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cpifn","text":"If the quality at the end of the sequence is less than 20, you can perform a sequence cut using the \"CROP:\" option, where you should enter the value of the maximum length to which the sequences should be trimmed. For example, if your sequences are 150 nts, and you want to remove the last 12 nts, enter CROP:138. Later, for sequences with these characteristics, it is recommended to use the \"SLIDEWINDOW:\" command to perform cuts by quality windows. For example, if we add the command \"SLIDEWINDOW:5:15\", the program will analyze every 5 nucleotides of the sequence looking for an average quality of 15, and if it is lower, it will cut those nucleotides from the sequence.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f9s14","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6l90j","text":" If your reads are of good quality, you can simply use the \"AVGQUAL:\" command with recommended values of 18, 20, or 22, as this option will only retain the reads that exceed this average quality value. If you have low quality at the beginning of your reads, you can perform a cut using the \"HEADCROP:\" option and add the number of nucleotides to be cut.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8vs56","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9g5ie","text":" Additionally, you can filter by the minimum sequence size you want for your reads using the \"MINLEN:\" option, where it is recommended to use a value of 100 for reads of 2x150, 150 for reads of 2x200, and 200 for reads of 2x250. The values for each program option should be used according to the characteristics of your reads and at your discretion.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9fkv5","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"547gu","text":"Optionally, although it is recommended, you can use the Prinseq-lite program with the entropy filtering method to discard low complexity sequences from your reads. These include sequences with 1, 2 or 3 nucleotide repeats throughout the sequence. The result is found in the file Archive_R1-2_good_xxx.fastq. The command is as follows:","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6hg28","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4cs73","text":"$  prinseq-lite -fastq Archive_trimmo_results_R1.fastq -fastq2 Archive_trimmo_results_R2.fastq -lc_method  entropy -lc_threshold 68 -out_format 3","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8b5aj","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5t6hh","text":"If you wish, this program can also be used to perform quality processing of your sequences. To do so, please refer to the manual on the website, which you can visit using the link described in the materials section of this protocol, or alternatively by using the command \"prinseq-lite -h\".","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58n0n","text":"First, to collect a shrimp sample, put on sterile latex gloves and remove the exoskeleton without detaching the cephalothorax zone. Then, hold the shrimp with your dominant hand and apply measured pressure to expose the hepatopancreas and gut. Next, cut along the shrimp following the same line as the gut, careful not to damage the organ. Cut the gut connection with the hepatopancreas, and open the shrimp like a butterfly following the previously made cut. Finally, transfer the gut using surgical forceps to a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube with preservation reagent. Keep the RNAlater sample at 4ºC for 48 hours and posteriorly maintain it at -70 C until use. Contrary, save the glycerol sample directly in liquid nitrogen and keep it at -70 until use. Remember to take the necessary precautions to ensure the integrity of your samples and obtain accurate results.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ov6n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b7tf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5abt1","text":"       ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":2,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aupnq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqa5e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7tnev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"65E89B93345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":316,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"anjqi\",\"text\":\"Figure 1. {"blocks":[{"key":"6uv6k","text":"To only use the chemical lysis skip to step 10 and add 1,200 µl of the Genomic Lysis Buffer to the sample. Continue with the following steps as specified.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eaukv","text":"For the mechanical lysis transfer the gut sample in PBS buffer to a ZR Bashing Bead Lysis Tube and add 700 µl of BashingBead Buffer. Secure the tube in a Vortex Genie2 and agitate for 5 min at maximum speed. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ouaq","text":"Centrifuge the ZR BashingBead™ Lysis Tube in a microcentrifuge at ≥ 10,000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42mn5","text":"Transfer up to 400 µl supernatant to a Zymo-Spin™ III-F Filter in a collection tube and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnern","text":"Add 1,200 µl of the Genomic Lysis Buffer to the filtrate in the collection Tube from the previous step. Mix well.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43lvn","text":"Transfer 800 µl of the mixture from the previous step to a Zymo-Spin™ IICR column in a collection tube and centrifuge at 10,000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bi8m5","text":"Discard the flow through from the collection tube and repeat the previous step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8edgn","text":"Add 200 µl DNA Pre-wash buffer to the Zymo-Spin™ IICR Column in a new collection tube and centrifuge at 10,000 x g for 1 minute","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoam6","text":"Add 500 µl g-DNA wash buffer to the Zymo-Spin™ IICR Column and centrifuge at 10,000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2s53r","text":"Transfer the Zymo-Spin™ IICR column to a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube and add 100 µl (50 µl minimum) DNA elution buffer directly to the column matrix. Centrifuge at 10,000 x g for 30 seconds to elute the DNA.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e942","text":"Place a Zymo-Spin™ III-HRC filter in a clean collection Tube and add 600 µl prep solution. Centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 3 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arpfa","text":"Transfer the eluted DNA to a prepared Zymo-Spin™ III-HRC Filter in a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube and centrifuge at exactly 16,000 x g for 3 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9nkv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qmuk","text":"The purified DNA should be stored at -20ºC until use. For long storage periods ranging from months to years, -80 °C is recommended.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7b52t","text":"Add 5 μl Index 1 to the tube with purified amplicon.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8v59f","text":"Add 5 μl Index 2 to the tube with purified amplicon.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54fbq","text":"Gently pipette up and down 10 times to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4vd13","text":"PCR Clean-Up","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28pvr","text":"This step uses AMPure XP beads to clean up the final library before quantification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"152sp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b22h5","text":"Centrifuge the Index PCR tube at 280 x g at 20 °C for 1 minute to collect condensation. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3be6","text":"Vortex the AMPure XP beads for 30 seconds to make sure that the beads are evenly dispersed. Add an appropriate volume of beads to a trough. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2t05o","text":"Add 56 μl of AMPure XP beads to the Index PCR tube.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fnigr","text":"Gently pipette mix up and down 10 times.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5vmer","text":"Incubate at room temperature without shaking for 5 minutes. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2oe8h","text":"Place the tube on a magnetic stand for 2 minutes, or until the supernatant has cleared. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k8e8","text":"With the Index PCR tube on the magnetic stand, use a pipette to remove and discard the supernatant. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91qpi","text":"-Incubate the tube on the magnetic stand for 30 seconds. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vl5e","text":"-Carefully remove and discard the supernatant. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g978","text":"-Carefully remove and discard the supernatant. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3oi9f","text":"-Use a pipette with fine pipette tips to remove excess ethanol. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fubl3","text":"With the Index PCR tube still on the magnetic stand, allow the beads to air-dry for 10 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8bpth","text":"Remove the Index PCR tube from the magnetic stand.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2c42i","text":"Using a pipette, add 27.5 μl of H2O to the Index PCR tube. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e3vrt","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"948d","text":"Place the tube on the magnetic stand for 2 minutes, or until the supernatant has cleared. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2i539","text":"Using a pipette, carefully transfer 25 μl of the supernatant from the Index PCR tube to a new eppendorff tube.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98io0","text":"Library Quantification","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76jca","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59jco","text":"Illumina recommends quantifying your libraries using a fluorometric quantification method that uses dsDNA binding dyes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22evc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnjcu","text":"Calculate DNA concentration in nM, based on the size of DNA amplicons as determined by an Agilent Technologies 2100 Bioanalyzer trace:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hiuq","text":"(concentration in ng/μl) × 106 = (660 g/mol × average library size)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atkq4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73ehk","text":"For example:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h00p","text":"15 ng/μl × 106 = (660 g/mol × 500)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qoic","text":"concentration in nM","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kh7g","text":"45 nM","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vu2k","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1946f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6bll","text":" However, if you need to perform it yourself, follow this step as usual.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bh899","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2afl5","text":"The final amount of purified library necessary for sequencing depends on the sequencing depth required for each sample and the sequencing platform. Please refer to the person in charge of the sequencing service to confirm the requirements.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhemc","text":"Sequencing the sample in 2x150 pb for the V3 region is necessary, with a recommended total number of reads of 100k to 200k per sample. The amount of DNA recommended in this protocol may vary between service units.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
